document_data.name: Alathrien Druanna
document_data.title: The Rune Mistress
document_data.power2e: [[Demigod|Demipower]]<ref group="note">Alathrien Druanna originates in a "setting neutral" ''Dragon'' magazine article about the Seldarine, and as such it is unclear as to what extent, if any, she is worshiped in the Forgotten Realms.
document_data.symbol2e:
A silver quill tracing elven runes upon paper
A stick tracing geometric lines upon the ground
document_data.spheres2e: [[All sphere|All]], [[Astral sphere|Astral]], [[Divination sphere|Divination]], [[Guardian sphere|Guardian]], [[Healing sphere|Healing]], [[Numbers sphere|Numbers]], [[Summoning sphere|Summoning]]'''minor:'''[[Law sphere|Law]], [[Necromantic sphere|Necromantic]], [[Sun sphere|Sun]]
document_data.mainbody: '''Alathrien Druanna''' was a minor [[elf|elven]] [[deity|goddess]] of [[Magic#Rune magic|rune]] and [[conjuration]] [[magic]]. She was a nearly-forgotten member of the [[Seldarine]], as most elves practicing magic called upon [[Corellon Larethian]] for aid.
document_data.Activities: Alathrien spent most of her time studying runic magic.
document_data.Relationships: Alathrien's studious nature led her to ally with deities such as [[Deneir]] and [[Dugmaren Brightmantle]]. She had no real enemies of her own, but deities seeking to elevate themselves at the expense of the Seldarine (such as [[Talos]]) often targeted her first. These attempts invariably failed, and only alerted the Seldarine to greater watchfulness.
document_data.Worshipers: Alathrien's church was composed mostly of scholars and mages of runic and geometry magic. They tended more towards academic debate than caring for the sick and poor, but tried their best at the latter. The church celebrated no set holy days, instead declaring one whenever there great knowledge was gained in the field of magic.
